question: From where did the first European settlers in Canada come?
main_question: From where did the first European settlers in Canada come?
explanatory_sentence: In 1604, the first European settlement north of Florida was established by French explorers Pierre de Monts and Samuel de Champlain, first on St. Croix Island (in present-day Maine), then at Port-Royal, in Acadia (present-day Nova Scotia).
